intro: Clidemia phaeotricha, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dark green, velvety leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as tropical forests and is often found in disturbed areas. Clidemia phaeotricha is sometimes considered an invasive species in regions outside its native range.
